text: What is the purpose of the 'self' word in python.
I understand it refers to the specific object created from that class, but i cant see why it explicitly needs to be added to every function as a parameter.
To illustrate, in ruby, i could do this:

code:
class myClass
    def myFunc(name)
        @name = name
    end
end

text: Which i understand, quite easily, However in python i need to include self:

code:
class myClass:
    def myFunc(self, name):
        self.name = name

text: Can anyone talk me through this?
its not something ive come across in my (admittedly limited) experience.
